name: SOC 2
description: SOC 2 is the prevailing compliance standard for technology service providers, SaaS platforms, and cloud-native organizations. Developed by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), it evaluates an organization's information systems against the Trust Services Criteria (TSC). Unlike prescriptive frameworks, SOC 2 is principles-based - it evaluates whether controls effectively protect systems, giving flexibility to design controls that fit operational maturity.

lifecycle.name: Preparation & Scoping
lifecycle.description: Determine compliance objectives, select between Type 1 and Type 2 reports, define system boundaries, and identify applicable Trust Services Criteria.

lifecycle.name: Remediation & Implementation
lifecycle.description: Assign control ownership, develop missing policies, close gaps identified in readiness assessment, and implement technical controls.

lifecycle.name: Third-Party Attestation Audit
lifecycle.description: Engage an AICPA-accredited CPA firm to conduct the formal audit. Supply Management Assertion, System Description, and Control Matrix.

lifecycle.name: Maintaining Compliance
lifecycle.description: Continuous automated monitoring and strict testing cadence to ensure controls do not drift out of compliance as the business scales.

domains.name: Security (Common Criteria)
domains.description: Protection against unauthorized access, unauthorized disclosure, and damage that could compromise the entity's ability to achieve its objectives. This is the mandatory baseline for all SOC 2 audits.

controls.name: COSO Principle 1: Integrity and Ethical Values
controls.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values through the development of a code of conduct, communication of expected standards, and enforcement of compliance.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish and communicate a code of conduct. Implement whistleblower channels. Require annual ethics training for all employees.

controls.name: COSO Principle 2: Board Independence
controls.description: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal controls.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document board oversight activities. Maintain meeting minutes showing security governance discussions.

controls.name: COSO Principle 3: Management Structure
controls.description: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define organizational chart with security reporting lines. Assign CISO or equivalent role with clear authority.

controls.name: COSO Principle 4: Commitment to Competence
controls.description: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement security awareness training programs. Include security competence in job descriptions and performance evaluations.

controls.name: COSO Principle 5: Accountability
controls.description: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Assign control owners for each security domain. Track control effectiveness with documented accountability measures.

controls.name: Information Quality for Internal Control
controls.description: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal controls.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement a centralized GRC platform to aggregate control status. Ensure data quality through validation and reconciliation.

controls.name: Internal Communication of Security Objectives
controls.description: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.
controls.implementationGuidance: Distribute security policies to all employees. Conduct regular security awareness communications. Maintain an internal security wiki.

controls.name: External Communication
controls.description: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain a public security page. Establish vulnerability disclosure and incident notification processes. Publish SOC 2 report summaries to customers.

controls.name: Risk Assessment Objectives
controls.description: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Document risk appetite statement. Define security objectives aligned with business goals. Establish risk assessment methodology.

controls.name: Risk Identification and Analysis
controls.description: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct annual risk assessments. Maintain a risk register. Perform threat modeling for new features and infrastructure changes.

controls.name: Fraud Risk Assessment
controls.description: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include fraud risk scenarios in risk assessments. Monitor for anomalous access patterns and financial transactions.

controls.name: Change Risk Assessment
controls.description: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement change management processes that include security impact assessments. Require security review for infrastructure and application changes.

controls.name: Monitoring Control Design and Effectiveness
controls.description: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy automated compliance monitoring tools. Conduct periodic internal audits. Track control effectiveness through dashboards.

controls.name: Evaluation and Communication of Deficiencies
controls.description: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish exception reporting and remediation tracking processes. Communicate deficiencies to control owners and management within defined SLAs.

controls.name: Selection and Development of Controls
controls.description: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.
controls.implementationGuidance: Design controls based on risk assessment results. Document control objectives and testing procedures. Map controls to specific risks.

controls.name: Technology General Controls
controls.description: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement IT general controls including access management, change management, and operations controls across all production systems.

controls.name: Policy Deployment
controls.description: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and procedures that put policies into action.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain a comprehensive policy library. Version control all policies using Git. Require annual review and update. Track employee acknowledgment.

controls.name: Logical and Physical Access Controls
controls.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement role-based access control (RBAC). Enforce MFA for all production systems. Use SSO where possible. Conduct quarterly access reviews.

controls.name: User Registration and Authorization
controls.description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new users whose access is restricted to authorized personnel.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement formal user provisioning and deprovisioning workflows. Require manager approval for access requests. Auto-deprovision on termination.

controls.name: Role-Based Access and Least Privilege
controls.description: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement least-privilege access controls. Use RBAC with predefined roles. Conduct quarterly entitlement reviews. Remove excessive permissions.

controls.name: System Boundary Protection
controls.description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy firewalls, WAFs, and intrusion detection/prevention systems. Segment networks. Manage ingress and egress points.

controls.name: Restriction of Data Transmission
controls.description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce TLS 1.2+ for all data in transit. Implement DLP controls. Restrict USB and removable media. Monitor data exfiltration.

controls.name: Unauthorized Software Prevention
controls.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy endpoint protection on all workstations. Implement application whitelisting. Scan dependencies for known vulnerabilities.

controls.name: Detection of Security Events
controls.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify anomalies that are indicative of security events.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement SIEM or centralized log management. Define detection rules for critical events. Monitor for unauthorized access attempts.

controls.name: Security Event Monitoring
controls.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enable comprehensive application and infrastructure logging. Use automated alerts for critical thresholds. Implement 24/7 monitoring for production systems.

controls.name: Security Incident Evaluation
controls.description: The entity evaluates identified security events to determine whether controls have been compromised and whether incident response is required.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define incident severity classification. Implement triage procedures. Document evaluation criteria. Escalate based on severity.

controls.name: Security Incident Response
controls.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop and test incident response plan. Define communication protocols. Conduct tabletop exercises annually. Integrate with breach notification requirements.

controls.name: Incident Recovery
controls.description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define recovery procedures. Maintain backup and restoration capabilities. Test disaster recovery plans. Document lessons learned.

controls.name: Change Management Controls
controls.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement formal change management with approval workflows. Require peer review for all code changes. Maintain change logs. Track emergency changes separately.

controls.name: Risk Mitigation
controls.description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement business continuity plans. Maintain insurance for cyber risks. Define risk acceptance criteria. Track risk treatment plans.

controls.name: Vendor and Third-Party Risk Management
controls.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain a vendor inventory. Assess vendor security posture. Require SOC 2 or ISO 27001 from critical vendors. Review vendor risk annually.

domains.name: Availability
domains.description: The system is available for operation and use as committed or agreed. Required when organizations offer strict uptime SLAs.

controls.name: Capacity Planning
controls.description: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components to manage capacity demand.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement auto-scaling. Monitor resource utilization. Set capacity thresholds and alerts. Plan for peak demand.

controls.name: Environmental Protections and Recovery
controls.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections to meet availability commitments.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement disaster recovery plans. Deploy across multiple availability zones. Test backup restoration regularly. Define and meet RTO/RPO targets.

controls.name: Recovery Testing
controls.description: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct annual DR drills. Test backup restoration. Document test results and remediate gaps. Simulate failover scenarios.

domains.name: Processing Integrity
domains.description: System processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized. Required for financial, transactional, or analytical data transformation systems.

controls.name: Processing Accuracy and Completeness
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system processing to ensure processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement input validation. Use checksums and reconciliation for data processing. Log all data transformations. Implement idempotency for critical operations.

controls.name: Processing Error Handling
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures to detect processing errors and take corrective action to ensure data integrity.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement error handling and retry mechanisms. Alert on processing failures. Maintain error logs with root cause analysis.

controls.name: Processing Inputs and Outputs
controls.description: The entity implements policies and procedures over system inputs to ensure inputs are processed completely and accurately and outputs are distributed only to intended recipients.
controls.implementationGuidance: Validate all API inputs. Sanitize outputs. Restrict data distribution to authorized recipients. Implement data flow controls.

domains.name: Confidentiality
domains.description: Information designated as confidential is protected as committed or agreed. Required when storing IP, sensitive documents, or proprietary client data.

controls.name: Identification of Confidential Information
controls.description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement data classification scheme (Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted). Label and tag data accordingly. Train employees on classification.

controls.name: Disposal of Confidential Information
controls.description: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define data retention schedules. Implement automated data purging. Securely wipe storage media. Document disposal procedures.

domains.name: Privacy
domains.description: Personal information is collected, used, retained, disclosed, and disposed of in conformity with the entity's privacy commitments. Required when collecting personal data subject to consumer privacy regulations.

controls.name: Privacy Notice and Consent
controls.description: The entity provides notice to data subjects about its privacy practices and obtains consent, where required.
controls.implementationGuidance: Publish clear privacy policy. Implement consent management. Provide opt-out mechanisms. Document lawful basis for processing.

controls.name: Data Subject Access Requests
controls.description: The entity implements a process for data subjects to request access to, modification of, or deletion of their personal information.
controls.implementationGuidance: Build DSAR workflow. Respond within regulatory timeframes (30 days GDPR). Automate data export and deletion where possible.

controls.name: Data Quality and Minimization
controls.description: The entity collects only the personal information necessary and maintains the quality of personal data.
controls.implementationGuidance: Audit data collection points. Remove unnecessary data fields. Validate data accuracy. Implement data quality checks.

breachNotification.timeframe: Varies by contractual obligation and state law
breachNotification.threshold: Determined by contractual and legal requirements
